definition: wishing for profit, but causing loss (idiom); good intentions that lead to disaster/It all ends in tears.
to wish for/to desire/variant of 慾|欲[yu4]
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
to decrease/to lose/to damage/to harm/(coll.) to speak sarcastically/to deride/caustic/mean/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷨)
